minesweeper

Class MineSweeperGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • minesweeper.MineSweeperGame

  • public class MineSweeperGame
extends java.lang.Object
    This class creates a fully functional Minesweeper board and makes all decisions regarding the state of the game.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Matthew Shampine, Connor Dudas

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      MineSweeperGame(int size, int numMines)
      Constructor that initializes a 2D array of cells, filling all of the cells with default values.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MineSweeperGame

        public MineSweeperGame(int size,
                       int numMines)
        Constructor that initializes a 2D array of cells, filling all of the cells with default values. In addition, mines are placed randomly throughout the board and the mine count of neighboring cells are established.
        Parameters:
        size - The desired size of the board to be created
        numMines - The amount of mines that will in the game

      • MineSweeperGame

        public MineSweeperGame(int size)
        Constructor that initializes a 2D array of cells, filling all of the cells with default values. This constructor creates a new game when a file is loaded. It does not add the mines to the board or set the mine count.
        Parameters:
        size - The desired size of the board to be created

    • Method Detail

      • selectCell

        public void selectCell(int row,
                       int col)
        This method handles the logic when a user clicks on a cell. It first exposes the cell then checks whether or not there are any non-mine cells that haven't been exposed. Next it checks if the user clicked on a mine, and lastly if the cell has a mine count of 0 it opens up the neighboring cells.
        Parameters:
        row - The row of the cell location
        col - The col of the cell location

      • save

        public void save(java.lang.String filename)
        This method saves off the current status of the game to a file. The properties of the game that are stored are the size of the game board and the number of mines the game has. In addition to this, the game saves for each cell: the row of the board, the col of the board, the current mine count of that cell, whether of not the cell is a mine, has been flagged, and lastly whether or not the cell has been exposed.
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of the file that is saved and written to
        Throws:
        java.util.InputMismatchException - If the user tries to save a lost game

      • load

        public void load(java.lang.String filename)
        This method loads the saved game and recreates the board from the properties found in the file.
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of the file that the properties are loaded from
        Throws:
        java.util.InputMismatchException - If the contents of the file has been altered and it cannot parse correctly
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - If the contents of the file has been altered and it cannot parse correctly
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - If the contents of the file has been altered and it cannot parse correctly

      • getSize

        public int getSize(java.lang.String filename)
        This method just gets the size of the board from a file.
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of the file that the properties are loaded from
        Returns:
        int The size of the board
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - If the contents of the file has been altered and it cannot parse correctly

      • setLoadSuccessful

        public void setLoadSuccessful(boolean loadSuccessful)
        This setter method sets the status of whether or not the file has been loaded correctly.
        Parameters:
        loadSuccessful - Whether or not the file has been loaded correctly

      • isloadSuccessful

        public boolean isloadSuccessful()
        This getter method returns whether or not the file was properly loaded.
        Returns:
        boolean If the file has been loaded correctly

      • getCell

        public Cell getCell(int row,
                    int col)
        This helper method checks that the current cell exists. If the cell does not exist it returns null and if the cell does exist it returns that cell.
        Parameters:
        row - The row of the cell location
        col - The col of the cell location
        Returns:
        Cell This returns the cell, provided that it exists
